<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | Unorder | Yes/No   | All                | == Relaxed | == Relaxed                   |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | Other   | Yes      | Generic, Shared,   | Error &#91;2&#93;  | &lt;atomic sem&gt; &#91;3&#93;             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |         |          | / Global &#91;0&#93;       |            |                              |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Lowering of CUDA C++ SequentiallyConsistent Operations and Fences to PTX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by following the ABI proven sound in:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   Lustig et al, A Formal Analysis of the NVIDIA PTX Memory Consistency Model, ASPLOS19.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3297858.3304043</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | CUDA C++ Atomic Operation or Atomic Fence            | PTX Atomic Operation or Fence |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | cuda::atomic&#95;thread&#95;fence                            | fence.sc.&lt;scope&gt;;             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |   (memory&#95;order&#95;seq&#95;cst, cuda::thread&#95;scope&#95;&lt;scope&gt;) |                               |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | cuda::atomic&#95;load                                    | fence.sc.&lt;scope&gt;;             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |   (memory&#95;order&#95;seq&#95;cst, cuda::thread&#95;scope&#95;&lt;scope&gt;) | ld.acquire.&lt;scope&gt;;           |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------|  </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | cuda::atomic&#95;store                                   | fence.sc.&lt;scope&gt;;             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |   (memory&#95;order&#95;seq&#95;cst, cuda::thread&#95;scope&#95;&lt;scope&gt;) | st.release.&lt;scope&gt;;           |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------|</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// | cuda::atomic&#95;fetch&#95;&lt;op&gt;                              | fence.sc.&lt;scope&gt;;             |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |   (memory&#95;order&#95;seq&#95;cst, cuda::thread&#95;scope&#95;&lt;scope&gt;) | atom.acq&#95;rel.&lt;scope&gt;;         |</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// clang-format on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;0&#93;: volatile and atomics are only supported on global or shared</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      memory locations, accessed via generic/shared/global pointers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      MMIO is only supported on global memory locations,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      accessed via generic/global pointers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Implement MMIO access via generic pointer to global.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//       Currently implemented for global pointers only.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;1&#93;: Lowering volatile/atomic operations to non-volatile/non-atomic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      PTX instructions fails to preserve their C++ side-effects.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      Example (https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/62057):</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          void example() &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//              std::atomic&lt;bool&gt; True = true;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//              while (True.load(std::memory&#95;order&#95;relaxed));</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      A C++ program that calls &quot;example&quot; is well-defined: the infinite loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      performs an atomic operation. By lowering volatile/atomics to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      &quot;weak&quot; memory operations, we are transforming the above into:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          void undefined&#95;behavior() &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//              bool True = true;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//              while (True);</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      which exhibits undefined behavior in both C++ and PTX.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      Calling &quot;example&quot; in CUDA C++ compiled for sm&#95;60- exhibits undefined</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      behavior due to lack of Independent Forward Progress. Lowering these</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      to weak memory operations in sm&#95;60- is therefore fine.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      TODO: lower atomic and volatile operations to memory locations</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      in local, const, and param to two PTX instructions in sm&#95;70+:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        - the &quot;weak&quot; memory instruction we are currently lowering to, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        - some other instruction that preserves the side-effect, e.g.,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//          a dead dummy volatile load.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86afa222eeb9d903482895b95ece2b983b7">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Local</a> ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><Highlight kind="normal">      CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86a78523d34068fb7d8996627878dd5ba19">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Const</a> ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><Highlight kind="normal">      CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86a2f6244cb6b1966052e52af35d910cf8d">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Param</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#adcf87377f3df8d9008825b7fc46f4f01a8392068ab98bc624c0f367e662639412">NVPTX::Ordering::NotAtomic</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;2&#93;: Atomics with Ordering different than Unordered or Relaxed are not</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;3&#93;: TODO: these should eventually use .mmio&lt;.atomic sem&gt;; for now we drop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the volatile semantics and preserve the atomic ones.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PTX volatile and PTX atomics are not available for statespace that differ</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// from .generic, .global, or .shared. The behavior of PTX volatile and PTX</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// atomics is undefined if the generic address does not refer to a .global or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// .shared memory location.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AddrGenericOrGlobalOrShared =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="normal">       CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86a1db64802d3774048124b6d35acbb48b8">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Global</a> ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="normal">       CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86a54c619e65d06a9f19b7bb89cef76b1a9">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Shared</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!AddrGenericOrGlobalOrShared)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal">      HasRelaxedMMIO &amp;&amp; CodeAddrSpace == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptx/#a33cca915c8026e43ecc98a96089a6b86a1db64802d3774048124b6d35acbb48b8">NVPTX::AddressSpace::Global</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Despite vectors like v8i8, v16i8, v8i16 being within the bit-limit for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="995"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// total load/store size, PTX syntax only supports v2/v4. Thus, we can&#39;t use</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="996"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vectorized loads/stores with the actual element type for i8/i16 as that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="997"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would require v8/v16 variants that do not exist.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="998"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In order to load/store such vectors efficiently, in Type Legalization</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="999"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we split the vector into word-sized chunks (v2x16/v4i8). Now, we will</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01000" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1000"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// lower to PTX as vectors of b32.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm-mb/#ad70272e2a9ec2a7e3a497458e1edbc85a7289f7156c17c31399fe5226bf556781">LD</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondagisel/#a2b37615f95f3e2fdd5564188c0965132">CurDAG</a>-&gt;getMachineNode(&#42;Opcode, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, InstVTList, <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a926d7ce2143863b7a2afda0fca4d2b65">Ops</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For automatic generation of LDG (through SelectLoad&#91;Vector&#93;, not the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intrinsics), we may have an extending load like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   i32,ch = load&lt;LD1&#91;%data1(addrspace=1)&#93;, zext from i8&gt; t0, t7, undef:i64</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1543"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In this case, the matching logic above will select a load for the original</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1544"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memory type (in this case, i8) and our types will not match (the node needs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1545"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to return an i32 in this case). Our LDG/LDU nodes do not support the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1546"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// concept of sign-/zero-extension, so emulate it here by adding an explicit</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1547"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CVT instruction. Ptxas should clean up any redundancies here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><Highlight kind="normal">  LoadSDNode &#42;LdNode = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadSDNode&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OrigType != EltVT &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><Highlight kind="normal">      (LdNode || (OrigType.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a3cb888a2ce8e95e0d9769687a5e2f7d8">isFloatingPoint</a>() &amp;&amp; EltVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a3cb888a2ce8e95e0d9769687a5e2f7d8">isFloatingPoint</a>()))) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We have an extending-load. The instruction we selected operates on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// smaller type, but the SDNode we are replacing has the larger type. We</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need to emit a CVT to make the types match.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CvtOpc =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><Highlight kind="normal">        GetConvertOpcode(OrigType.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a6a81c1cc06a00a0096d839032b5984e9">getSimpleVT</a>(), EltVT.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a6a81c1cc06a00a0096d839032b5984e9">getSimpleVT</a>(), LdNode);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1558"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1559"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For each output value, apply the manual sign/zero-extension and make sure</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1560"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// all users of the load go through that CVT.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1561"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0; i != NumElts; ++i) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1562"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> Res(LD, i);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1563"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> OrigVal(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>, i);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This helps to avoid creating redundant COPY instructions in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2266"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Canonicalize the operands</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2279"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t MaskVal = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/bitmaskenumdetail/#a4562904154aff9698a612bc7f6086a4c">Mask</a>-&gt;getZExtValue();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2281"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We &#42;could&#42; handle shifted masks here, but doing so would require an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2282"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#39;and&#39; operation to fix up the low-order bits so we would trade</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2283"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// shr+and for bfe+and, which has the same throughput</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2298"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// How many &quot;good&quot; bits do we have left?  &quot;good&quot; is defined here as bits</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2300"><Highlight kind="normal">        int64&#95;t GoodBits = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/memprof/#abee3ddc7c6eb611a3b96fb69489c81caaa6122a65eaa676f700ae68d393054a37">Start</a>.getValueSizeInBits() - StartVal;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><Highlight kind="normal">      uint64&#95;t NumZeros;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><Highlight kind="normal">      uint64&#95;t NumBits;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a82a9558b6319303ae62f59dab9669685">isMask&#95;64</a>(MaskVal)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><Highlight kind="normal">        NumZeros = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The number of bits in the result bitfield will be the number of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// trailing ones (the AND) minus the number of bits we shift off</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><Highlight kind="normal">        NumBits = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a239abca11deebf2731206dd41cf43c0e">llvm::countr&#95;one</a>(MaskVal) - ShiftAmt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a582e08755c7a8d1b0bf6c5dcb765aaa8">isShiftedMask&#95;64</a>(MaskVal)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><Highlight kind="normal">        NumZeros = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a57d2f9ee99e9e68cff564d0d579c8163">llvm::countr&#95;zero</a>(MaskVal);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2355"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumOnes = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a239abca11deebf2731206dd41cf43c0e">llvm::countr&#95;one</a>(MaskVal &gt;&gt; NumZeros);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The number of bits in the result bitfield will be the number of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2357"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// trailing zeros plus the number of set bits in the mask minus the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2358"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of bits we shift off</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2359"><Highlight kind="normal">        NumBits = NumZeros + NumOnes - ShiftAmt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2360"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2361"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is not a mask we can handle</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2362"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2363"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2364"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2365"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (ShiftAmt &lt; NumZeros) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2366"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Handling this case would require extra logic that would make this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2367"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transformation non-profitable</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2368"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>-&gt;getOpcode() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a8cc94e03dea594863073a02f5bb94997">ISD::SHL</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Here, we have a pattern like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// or</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2382"><Highlight kind="normal">      Val = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>-&gt;getOperand(0);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64isellowering-cpp/#a51cb24bd3e700fcf2f93d1afbb555a16">SDValue</a> ShrRHS = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2994"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsIm2Col) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2995"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We have &#123;Chain, Intrinsic-ID&#125; followed by the actual intrisic args:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2996"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#123;dst, mbar, src, dims&#123;d0...dN&#125;, im2col&#95;offsets&#123;dims-2&#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2997"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multicast, cache&#95;hint,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3001"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getNumOperands();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3002"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumDims = IsIm2Col ? <a href="#a4febf7c53836e7bca48be0327db78d85">GetDimsFromIntrinsic</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getConstantOperandVal(1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3003"><Highlight kind="normal">                            : (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> - 9);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3004"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Offsets is always &#39;NumDims - 2&#39; and only for im2col mode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3005"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumOffsets = IsIm2Col ? (NumDims - 2) : 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3006"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsCacheHint = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getConstantOperandVal(<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> - 1) == 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3007"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsMultiCast = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getConstantOperandVal(<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> - 2) == 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getNumOperands();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3063"><Highlight kind="normal">                            : (<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> - 5);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3064"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Offsets is always &#39;NumDims - 2&#39; and only for im2col mode</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3065"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumOffsets = IsIm2Col ? (NumDims - 2) : 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3066"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IsCacheHint = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>-&gt;getConstantOperandVal(<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/demangle/itaniumdemangle-h/#a536e22898d28a9340a4204407a75ad5d">NumOps</a> - 1) == 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3067"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumArgs = NumDims + NumOffsets + (IsCacheHint ? 2 : 1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3068"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
